headline: Moody’s Expands Risk Tools As Private Credit Scrutiny And Valuation Questions Grow
summary: Moody's (NYSE:MCO) recently acquired Numerated Growth Technologies to expand its lending technology capabilities. The company also acquired CAPE Analytics, adding advanced property and insurance risk modeling tools to its platform. These deals come as the private credit market, now around $2tn in size, faces increased regulatory scrutiny. Moody's, best known for its credit ratings and analytics, is building out a broader toolkit that serves banks, insurers, and private credit investors. By...

headline: Red River Bancshares (RRBI) Q4 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Red River Bancshares (RRBI) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +6.14% and +2.72%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Assessing Whether Moody’s (MCO) Premium P/E Is Justified By Its Long Term Growth Story
summary: Why Moody's Stock Is on Investors' Radar Today With no single headline event driving Moody's (MCO) today, investors are instead focusing on how its recent share performance and financial profile fit into a longer term risk assessment and analytics story. See our latest analysis for Moody's. Recent trading has been a bit soft, with a 7 day share price return of 2.79% and a 1 day slip of 0.23%, but a 90 day share price return of 7.32% and a 5 year total shareholder return of 94.13% point to...

headline: 2 Financials Stocks on Our Watchlist and 1 We Turn Down
summary: Financial firms serve as the backbone of the economy, providing essential services from lending and investment management to risk management and payment processing. But uncertainty about fiscal and monetary policy has tempered enthusiasm, limiting the industry's gains to 1.9% over the past six months. This return lagged the S&P 500's 9.6% climb.
